result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan G. Bacon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
On Case #15CM447-Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Bacon to serve 12 months in Jail concurrent with Case #16CF31-Count #1 and Case #16CF489-Count #1 (to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison System). 

In all three cases the Court STAYS these sentences and places Mr. Bacon on Probation for three years concurrent to each other, but consecutive to Dodge County Case #16CM178 and #16CM421

Concurrent with: Case #16CF31-Count #1 and Case #16CF489-Count #1 (to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison System).
In all three cases the Court STAYS these sentences and places Mr. Bacon on Probation for three years concurrent to each other, but consecutive to Dodge County Case #16CM178 and #16CM421.

miscConds.notes: Separate from the conditions of Probation the Court orders payment of costs and surcharges to the Clerk of Courts Office.  [amount calculated by the clerk and listed on the payment slip: $1,579. This amount includes the $100 domestic abuse surcharge in Case 15CM447 and $100 in drug testing fees in Case 16CF31] .  The Court grants Mr. Bacon sixty days to either pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment will result in 100 days in Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive [The Court sets a single alternate on the total amount due, so the 100 day alternate sentence jail term applies to each case, however these alternate jail terms are concurrent with each other, but consecutive to any other sentences.]
--to obtain and maintain employment and/or an education program

--no possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription

--not to possess drug paraphernalia including hypodermic needles unless medically necessary as confirmed by a treating physician

--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes or as deemed appropriate by the Agent

--no acts or threats of violence

--no contact with Gabrielle Hull unless approved by the Agent 

--no possession or ingestion of alcohol

--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores

--to undergo assessment, treatment, or counseling as may be required by the Agent

--to be subject to random drug and/or alcohol screening

--to take all prescription medications as prescribed

--to comply with DNA sample provision

Arresting Agency: Watertown PD

Further the Court reads-in uncharged referrals for Bailjumping on 4/17/16 (DA Case #16JE1084), and Retail Theft on 4/17/16 (DA Case #16JE1284), and Retail Theft & Misdemeanor Bailjumping on 1/11/16 (DA Case #16JE1601), and thereafter the Court bars further prosecution of these referrals.
--to undergo AODA assessment, treatment and follow through

[MK] cases #16CF31, #16CF489, #16CF515, #15CM447 called at 3:43pm. 
Defendant Ryan G. Bacon in court, in custody, with Attorney John A Chavez.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "  No Contest " entered on Case #16CF31-Count #1, and on Case C16CF489-Count #1, and on Case #15CM447-Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Bacon guilty, and orders Judgments of Conviction entered.
As to all three of these cases: Repeater Finding is made.
As to case #15CM447: Domestic Abuse Finding is made. 

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses the remaining counts [Case #16CF31-Counts 2,3,4,5], and Case #16CF515.   Further the Court reads-in uncharged referrals for Bailjumping on 4/17/16 (DA Case #16JE1084), and Retail Theft on 4/17/16 (DA Case #16JE1284), and Retail Theft & Misdemeanor Bailjumping on 1/11/16 (DA Case #16JE1601), and thereafter the Court bars further prosecution of these referrals. 

On Case #16CF31-Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Bacon to 6 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  2  years &  6 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years &  6 months.   This sentence is concurrent with Case #16CF31, but consecutive to any other sentence. 
The Court finds that Mr. Bacon is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. Bacon is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Days credit for time already served: 0.  The Court will allow counsel to submit a stipulation regarding any sentence credit due. 

On Case #16CF489-Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Bacon to  6 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  2  years &  6 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years &  6 months.  This sentence is concurrent with Case #16CF31, but consecutive to any other sentence. 
The Court finds that Mr. Bacon is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. Bacon is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Days credit for time already served: 0. The Court will allow counsel to submit a stipulation regarding any sentence credit due. 


On Case #15CM447-Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Bacon to serve 12 months in Jail concurrent with Case #16CF31-Count #1 and Case #16CF489-Count #1 (to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison System). 
Days credit for time already served: 0.  The Court will allow counsel to submit a stipulation regarding any sentence credit due. 

----------------------------------------------------------------------
In all three cases the Court STAYS these sentences and places Mr. Bacon on Probation for three years concurrent to each other, but consecutive to Dodge County Case #16CM178 and #16CM421.  Conditions of these Probation terms are: 
--in Case #16CF489-Count #1 only:  to serve 150 days in Jail with work-release privileges, to commence on May 27, 2018 when the jail term in the Dodge County cases concludes
--to undergo AODA assessment, treatment and follow through 
--to undergo assessment, treatment, or counseling as may be required by the Agent
--to be subject to random drug and/or alcohol screening
--to obtain and maintain employment and/or an education program
--no possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take all prescription medications as prescribed
--not to possess drug paraphernalia including hypodermic needles unless medically necessary as confirmed by a treating physician
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes or as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no acts or threats of violence
--no contact with Gabrielle Hull unless approved by the Agent 
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores 
--to comply with DNA sample provision

Separate from the conditions of Probation the Court orders payment of costs and surcharges to the Clerk of Courts Office.  [amount calculated by the clerk and listed on the payment slip: $1,579. This amount includes the $100 domestic abuse surcharge in Case 15CM447 and $100 in drug testing fees in Case 16CF31] .  The Court grants Mr. Bacon sixty days to either pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment will result in 100 days in Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive [The Court sets a single alternate on the total amount due, so the 100 day alternate sentence jail term applies to each case, however these alternate jail terms are concurrent with each other, but consecutive to any other sentences.] 
Felony Firearm prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 3:58pm

[MK] cases #15CM447 and #16CF31 called at 2:10pm. 
Defendant Ryan G. Bacon appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann (PD appears for bond purposes only; Mr. Bacon is not eligible for PD representation).  Public Service Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Right to counsel given.  The Court and counsel discuss that Attorney Fischer has been appointed as defense counsel for Mr. Bacon.
Initial Appearance held in Case #16CF31 only: 
---Mr. Bacon provides a new address:  315 S. Concord Avenue, Watertown WI 53094.
---Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited. 
---Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.  However the Defense requests that a Preliminary Hearing be scheduled at this point. 

The Court requires a $500 Cash Bond that applies to both Cases , with conditions:
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription 
--no use of needles and syringes without documented medical reasonsing 
recess  2:15pm.
